A

aboutDialog() - Method in class MainFrame
Displays a dialog which displays information about the game, the version, and the authors.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class Game
Compares the title of the action the user performed with a String and determines a response to their action.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class HighScoresPanel
Compares the title of the action the user performed with a String and determines a response to their action.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class Lesson
The purpose of this method is to determine what action is performed based on the button that was pressed.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class LevelSelect
Compares the title of the action the user performed with a String and determines a response to their action.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class MainFrame
This method processes the user input based on what menu item is clicked and processes a response.
addMirrors() - Method in class Game
Sets the mirrors on the game depending on what level it is.
animate() - Method in class SplashScreen
Creates a JPanel on the JFrame and adds a new JLabel to the JPanel.
askName() - Method in class Game
Uses a JDialog to get a name for the high score entry.
assignImage() - Method in class Game
Returns a random BufferedImage of a target which will be assigned to a Target object to be drawn.

B

Barrier - Class in <Unnamed>
The "Barrier" class, just defines a specific type of GameObject and coordinates for the rectangle.
Barrier(BufferedImage) - Constructor for class Barrier
A constructor for the class, sets a predetermined x-coord, y-coord, width, and height.

C

checkAdvance() - Method in class Game
Checks if the user is able to move onto the next level based on their score at the beginning of this level, and their current score.
checkEnd() - Method in class Game
Checks if any of the targets are at the end.
checkHit(Point) - Method in class Game
Returns the GameObject which containts this points, pretty much checking if this point has hit any GameObject.
checkScore() - Method in class Game
Checks if there is an empty spot for a high score entry, or if the current score is greater than or equal to the current lowest score on the list.
ConcaveMirror - Class in <Unnamed>
The "ConcaveMirror" class, similar to the CurvedMirror, but in a concave shape (the outside of a circle).
ConcaveMirror(int, int, int, int, boolean, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class ConcaveMirror
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, width, height, side which is reflective.
contains(Point2D) - Method in class ConcaveMirror
Checks if this point is found in the Ellipse2D or circle.
contains(Point2D) - Method in class CurvedMirror
Checks if this point is found in the Ellipse2D or circle.
contains(Point2D) - Method in class Mirror
Checks if this point is found in the Rectangle.
CurvedMirror - Class in <Unnamed>
The "CurvedMirror" class, a convex shaped mirror (inside of a ricle) which also has the ability to reflect lasers by creating a new laser based on where the old laser hit the mirror, and at what angle.
CurvedMirror(int, int, int, int, boolean, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class CurvedMirror
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, width, height, side which is reflective.

D

display() - Method in class HighScoresPanel
The purpose of this method is to display the high scores by creating labels for each entry and displaying it.
displayEntry(int, String, String, String) - Method in class HighScoresPanel
Displays one row of high scores by using JLabels and setting the constraints before adding them.

E

extend(int) - Method in class Laser
Extends laser to (getX () + length, and the corresponding y-coordinate based on the angle), setting currPoint to these coordinates, based on the laser's angle and starting point.

F

findTangentSlope(int) - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns the slope of the tangent of this circle at point (x, y), where the y value is specified.
findXCoord(double) - Method in class ConcaveMirror
Returns the x-coordinate of this mirror given the y-coordinate.
findXCoord(double) - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns the x-coordinate of this mirror given the y-coordinate.
fire() - Method in class Game
Disables the fire button and the keybinding for space.

G

Game - Class in <Unnamed>
The "Game" class, sets up a panel for the game, sets up the game space and sets and draws the game components based on the level.
Game(int, boolean, HighScoreEntry[], MainFrame) - Constructor for class Game
Constructor for the class, sets up the panel and the position of all the components.
GameObject - Class in <Unnamed>
The "GameObject" class, is the basis for all objects to be used in the actual logic for the game.
GameObject(int, int, int, int, int, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class GameObject
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, width, height, angle, and icon/image.
GameObject(int, int, int) - Constructor for class GameObject
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and angle.
GameObject() - Constructor for class GameObject
A default constructor.
generalDialog(boolean) - Method in class Game
Displays a dialog when the game is over (0 lives left), has a button to go back to main menu.
getAngle() - Method in class GameObject
Returns the value of the angle.
getCentreX() - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns the x component of the centre of the circle.
getCentreX() - Method in class Player
Returns the x-coord of the centre of this object.
getCentreY() - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns the y component of the centre of the circle.
getCentreY() - Method in class Player
Returns the y-coord of the centre of this object.

Returns the Ellipse2D of this object.
getCurrPoint() - Method in class Laser
Returns currPoint, or the current end point of the laser.

Returns the height.
getImage() - Method in class GameObject
Returns the image of this object.

Accessor method for the level.

Accessor method for the name.
getNumberOfPages() - Method in class Printer
Returns the number of pages that will be printed based on the number of text lines.

Used by PrinterJob to get the PageFormat for a certain page.
getPrintable(int) - Method in class Printer
Used by PrinterJob to render each of the pages.
getRadius() - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns the radius.
getRect() - Method in class GameObject
Returns the Rectangle of this object.
getReflectSide() - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns a boolean for which side is reflective, false for right side, true for left side.
getScore() - Method in class HighScoreEntry
Accessor method for the score.
getStartPoint() - Method in class Laser
Returns startPoint, the starting point of the laser.

Returns the width.

H

HighScoreEntry - Class in <Unnamed>
This is a data class used to store data of a single high score entry.
HighScoreEntry(String, int, int) - Constructor for class HighScoreEntry
Constructor used to create a high score entry with a name and score.
HighScoresPanel - Class in <Unnamed>
This class creates the JPanel that displays the top ten scores in a table.
HighScoresPanel(HighScoreEntry[], MainFrame) - Constructor for class HighScoresPanel
The purpose of this constructor is to create the JPanel for the high scores, initializes variables, sets up the buttons, labels, and keybindings.

L

Laser - Class in <Unnamed>
The "Laser" class, a type of GameObject in the shape of two points (a line).
Laser(int, int, int) - Constructor for class Laser
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and angle, and sets up the starting point and current end point (which initially is the same as the starting point).
Lesson - Class in <Unnamed>
This class creates the lesson panel where the user may scroll between 3 slides by clicking buttons.
Lesson(MainFrame) - Constructor for class Lesson
This constructs the lesson panel, setting up the layout, buttons, labels, and key bindings.
LevelSelect - Class in <Unnamed>
The "LevelSelect" class, sets up a panel for the user to select the level of the game they will play, or the type of level they will practice on.
LevelSelect(boolean, MainFrame) - Constructor for class LevelSelect
Constructor for the class, sets up the panel, sets up the key bindings, and adds the buttons.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class MainProgram
The main method.
MainFrame - Class in <Unnamed>
Creates a 1024 x 720 pixel window with a menu in the menu bar.
MainFrame() - Constructor for class MainFrame
Constructs the JFrame Window with menus and menu items.
MainProgram - Class in <Unnamed>
The driver class for the splash screen and main menu.
MainProgram() - Constructor for class MainProgram
 
mf - Variable in class MainFrame
mf reference for JFrame, points to the JFrame class.
Mirror - Class in <Unnamed>
The "Mirror" class, a type of GameObject which has a rectangular shape.
Mirror(int, int, int, int, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class Mirror
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord,width, and height.
move(int, int) - Method in class GameObject
Moves the object's x and y coordinates by newX and newY, respectively.

P

paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Game
Draws all the graphics relating to the game portion of this panel, such as all the targets, player, mirrors, background, lasers, barriers, end zones, and player zones.
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class HighScoresPanel
Draws a background image.
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Lesson
Draws a background image.
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class LevelSelect
Draws a background image.
pauseDialog(boolean) - Method in class Game
Stops the timer and shows a dialog representative of a pause menu.
Player - Class in <Unnamed>
The "Player" class, a type of GameObject which the player will be able to control by moving it up, down, left, right, or controlling which angle the player is facing.
Player(int, int, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class Player
A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and a predetermined width and height.
playerMove(int, int) - Method in class Game
Moves the player x length along the x-axis, and the y length along the y-axis, if the new coordinates for the player are still in the player zone.
print(String) - Method in class Printer
Queues a String alligned on the left side to be printed.
print(String, String, String) - Method in class Printer
Queues a line with different text alligned on different places to be printed.
print(Graphics, PageFormat, int) - Method in class Printer
Method invoked by PrinterJob to render a page.
Printer - Class in <Unnamed>
Helper class desinged to make printing easier.
Printer() - Constructor for class Printer
Creates a Printer object with Serif size 12 font and single spaced.
Printer(Font) - Constructor for class Printer
Creates a Printer object with a custom font and single spaced.
Printer(Font, double) - Constructor for class Printer
Creates a Printer object with a custom font and line spacing.
printImage(BufferedImage, Point) - Method in class Printer
Queues an image to be printed.
printImage(BufferedImage, Point, int, boolean) - Method in class Printer
Queues a square image to be printed with the length based on a percent of one of the dimensions of the paper.
printImage(BufferedImage, Point, int, int) - Method in class Printer
Queues an image to be printed with the length based on the percent of the dimensions of the paper.
println() - Method in class Printer
Queues an empty line to be printed.
println(String) - Method in class Printer
Queues a String alligned on the left side to be printed.
println(String, String, String) - Method in class Printer
Queues a line with different text alligned on different places to be printed.
printUsingDialog() - Method in class Printer
Signals the printer to start printing.
processLaser() - Method in class Game
Continuously extends the laser (incrementing the variable x), until it hits something, or is not in the game board anymore.

R

reflect(Laser) - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns a new reflected laser with a starting point of the old laser's ending point, and a new angle calculated on the slope of the tangent the old laser hit the mirror at, and the old laser's angle.
reflect(Laser) - Method in class Mirror
Returns a new reflected laser with a starting point of the old laser's ending point, and a new angle calculated on the slope of the tangent the old laser hit the mirror at, and the old laser's angle.

S

setAngle(int) - Method in class GameObject
Sets the angle for this object in degrees, with the value always being from 0 - 359, with 0 being up/forward/north, and going in a clockwise direction.
showGame(int, boolean) - Method in class MainFrame
This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the game panel.
showHighScores() - Method in class MainFrame
This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the high scores panel.
showLesson() - Method in class MainFrame
This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the lesson panel.
showLevelSelect(boolean) - Method in class MainFrame
This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the level select panel.
showMenu(char) - Method in class MainFrame
The purpose of this static method is to be used by the classes of other panels to return to the menu.
slopeToAngle(double) - Method in class CurvedMirror
Returns the integer of the angle value (in degrees with up/forward/north being 0, and going clockwise) of a slope of a line.
SplashScreen - Class in <Unnamed>
Creates a 600 x 600 pixel window with 2 with a short animating gif as the splash screen.
SplashScreen() - Constructor for class SplashScreen
Constructor for the SplashScreen class.

T

Target - Class in <Unnamed>
The "Target" class, a specific type of GameObject, and used in the Game class to handle logic.
Target(int, int, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class Target
A constructor for the class, sets a random x-coord; a predetermined y-coord; width, height, and icon/image.

W

write(HighScoreEntry[]) - Method in class MainFrame
This method writes to and updates the high score file.
